info.name: Zenduty API
info.description: List of all Zenduty API endpoints.

request.description: Get requested user profile

item.name: Account Custom Roles

request.description: This request will create a team.
This endpoint will get all the operations related to the team.
To get the details of the team.
This endpoint will delete the specified team.

item.description: All the API endpoints related to Account Custom Roles.

item.description: All the API endpoints related to User Custom Role.

item.name: Notification Rule
Create the User Notification Rule object

request.description: Create the User Notification Rule object by setting the values of all the required parameters passed in the request body.

request.description: Returns a list of User Notification Rule objects.

item.name: Retrieve the User Notification Rule object

request.description: Retrieve the specified User Notification Rule object.

item.name: Delete the User Notification Rule object

request.description: Delete the specified User Notification Rule object permanently.

item.name: Contact Method
Create the User Contact Method object

request.description: Create the User Contact Method object by setting the values of all the required parameters passed in the request body. A user can only create email contact method through API.

item.name: List all User Contact Method objects

request.description: Returns a list of User Contact Method objects.

item.name: Retrieve the User Contact Method object

request.description: Retrieve the specified User Contact Method object.

item.name: Delete the User Contact Method object

request.description: Delete the specified User Contact Method object permanently.

item.name: Teams

request.description: This request will create a team.
This endpoint will get all the operations related to the team.
To get the details of the team.
This endpoint will delete the specified team.

item.description: All the API endpoints related to Teams.

item.name: Team Members

request.description: This endpoints lets one get all the memebers of a specific team.

item.description: All the operations related to the members of a specific team.

item.name: Team Permissions
item.description: This API endpoint will handle all the operations related to Team Permission.

item.name: Schedules

body.raw:
{
	"name": "New Schedule",
	"summary": "Summary for the new Schedule",
	"descripition": "This is the description for the new Schedule",
	"time_zone": "Asia/Kolkata",
	"team": "{{team_id}}"
}

request.description: This request lets one create new Schedule.
Get all the Schedules for a specific Team
This request will get the Schedule by the specific ID.
This endpoint lets one update the Schedule. Anything in the schedule can be updated. Lets update the name of the Schedule.
This request lets one delete a Schedule for a specific team.

item.description: This endpoint will handle all the operations related to Schedules.

item.name: Escalation Policies

request.description: This request lets you create a new Escalation Policy.
This request will show you the escalation policies for the specified team.
This request will get the escalation policy by the specific ID of the Escalation Policy.
This request lets one Update and Escalation Policy.
This request to the endpoint letsone delete an Escalation Policy.

item.description: This API endpoint will handle all the operations related to Escalation Policies.

item.name: Services

body.raw:
{
	"name": "New Service",
	"collation": 1,
	"collation_time": 1,
	"description": "This is the description for the Service",
	"escalation_policy": "{{ep_id}}"
}

request.description: This request lets you add a new Service to a team.
To get all the services linked to a team.
This request will get you the service by its corresponding Service ID

body.raw:
{
	"name": "Modified Service Name",
	"collation": 1,
	"collation_time": 1,
	"description": "This is the modified description for the Service",
	"escalation_policy": "{{ep_id}}"

}

request.description: This endpoint lets one Update the Service details. In this case, the name of the service will be changed to "Modified Service Name".
This request letsone delete a service.

item.description: This API endpoint will handle all the operations related to Services.

item.name: Integrations

request.description: This request will let one create a new Integration for the specific Service.
This will show all the integrations under the service.
This request will get the Integration by integration ID.

body.raw:
{
	"name": "Updated Integration",
	"summary": "This is the summary for updated Integration",
    "create_incidents_for": 2,
    "default_urgency": 0,
    "is_enabled": false
}

item.description: This API will address all the Integrations related endpoints.

item.name: Integration Alerts
item.description: All the API endpoints related to Integration Alerts.

item.name: Incidents

body.raw:
{
	"service": "{{service_id}}",
	"escalation_policy": "{{ep_id}}",
	"user": null,
	"title": "Incident Title",
	"summary": "This is the summary for the incident"
}

request.description: This request will let one create a new incident.
This endpoint will give all the incidents for the account.
This request will get the specific incident by its Incident number.
This endpoint will let one Acknowledge any valid incident.
This endpoint will let one Resolve a specific incident.

item.description: All the API endpoints related to Incidetns.

item.name: Incident Roles

request.description: This endpoint lets one create a new Role for a specific Team.
This request will get all the Roles in a specific team.
This endpoint will let you update the information of a Role for a specific team. Lets modify the title of the Role to "Modified Role" and the Description to "Modified description".
This request lets one delete a Role a specific Team.

item.description: This endpoint will handle all the operations related to Roles.

item.name: Incident Notes

request.description: This request will get all the notes for the specific incident.

item.description: All the API endpoints related to Incident Notes.

item.name: Incident Tags

request.description: Create the Incident Tag object by setting the values of all the required parameters passed in the request body.
Returns a list of Incident Tag objects. The Incident Tag objects are sorted by creation_date, with the most recent Incident Note object appearing last.
Retrieve the specified Incident Tag object.
Delete the specified Incident Tag object permanently.

item.description: All the API endpoints related to Incident Tag.

item.name: Events

body.raw:
{
	"message": "[P-21041]Browser monitor global outage",
	"summary": "OPEN Problem P-21041 in environment zfw09965. Problem detected at: 17:58 (UTC) 27.04.2021",
	"alert_type": "critical",
	"suppressed": false,
	"entity_id": "INC00123",
    "payload":"{}"
}

request.description: This endpoint will give you the details of team priority

item.description: All the API endpoints related to Events.

item.name: Incident Alerts

request.description: This request will fetch all the alerts for the specific Incident.

item.description: All the API endpoints related to Incident Alerts.

item.name: Tags

request.description: This endpoint lets you create a new Tag for a specific team.
This request will get all the Roles for a specific team.
This request lets you delete a Tag.

item.description: This endpoint will handle all the Roles for a team.

item.name: Task Templates

request.description: This endpoint lets you create a Task Template for a specific Team.
This request will get all the Task Templates for the specific team.
This endpoint lets you update the Task Template details of a specific team.
This request lets you delete a Task Template for a specific Team.

item.description: This endpoint will handle all the operation related to Task Templates.

item.name: Priorities
item.description: This endpoint will handle all the operations related to team priority.

item.name: SLA

request.description: Create the SLA object by setting the values of all the required parameters passed in the request body.
Returns a list of SLA objects.
Retrieve the specified SLA object.
Updates the specified SLA object by setting the values of the parameters passed in the request body. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.
Delete the specified SLA object permanently.

item.description: This object represents the sla of the incident. You can checkout the sla docs here [https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/incidentsla](https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/incidentsla)

item.name: Team Maintenance Mode

request.description: Create the Team Maintenance Mode object by setting the values of all the required parameters passed in the request body.
Returns a list of Team Maintenance Mode objects. The Team Maintenance Mode objects are sorted by creation_date, with the most recent Team Maintenance Mode object appearing last.
Retrieve the specified Team Maintenance Mode object.
Updates the specified Team Maintenance Mode object by setting the values of the parameters passed in the request body. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.
Delete the specified Team Maintenance Mode object permanently.

item.description: This object represents the maintenance mode of the team. You can checkout the team maintenance mode docs here [https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/maintenancewindows](https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/maintenancewindows)

item.name: Team Postmortems

request.description: Create the Team Postmortem object by setting the values of all the required parameters passed in the request body.
Returns a list of Team Postmortem objects.
Retrieve the specified Postmortem object.
Updates the specified Team Postmortem object by setting the values of the parameters passed in the request body. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.
Delete the specified Postmortem object permanently.

item.description: This object represents the postmortem of the incident. You can checkout the postmortem docs here [https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/incidentpostmortem](https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/incidentpostmortem)

item.name: On Call
List details of who is On Call

request.description: This request will show you the on call detais

item.description: This object represents the user who is oncall.

item.name: Global Router

request.description: Create the Global Router object by setting the values of all the required parameters passed in the request body.
Returns a list of Global Router objects.
Retrieve the specified Global Router object.
Updates the specified Global Router object by setting the values of the parameters passed in the request body. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.
Delete the specified Global Router object permanently.

item.description: This object represents the Global Router of the Account. You can checkout the global alert routing docs here [https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/globalalertrouting](https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/globalalertrouting)

item.name: Global Router Rules
Create the Global Router Rule object

request.description: Create the Global Router Rule object by setting the values of all the required parameters passed in the request body.

item.name: List all Global Router Rule objects

request.description: Returns a list of Global Router Rule objects.

item.name: Update the Global Router Rule object

request.description: Updates the position of the Global Router Rule object by setting the position and rule unique id passed in the request body

item.name: Retrieve the Global Router Rule object

request.description: Retrieve the specified Global Router Rule object.

item.name: Update the Global Router Rule data

request.description: Updates the specified Global Router Rule object by setting the values of the parameters passed in the request body. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

item.name: Delete the Global Router Rule data

request.description: Delete the specified Global Router Rule object permanently.

item.description: The Rules of the Global Router in an Account are represented by this object. Visit this link to view the documentation for the global alert routing rules [https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/globalalertrouting](https://docs.zenduty.com/docs/globalalertrouting)
